item.title: 特朗普称国家经济委员会主任哈塞特进入美联储主席候选名单
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五再次表示，他支持国家经济委员会主任凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）成为可能的人选，以便在鲍威尔的任期于2026年5月结束时接替他担任美联储主席。【原文：President Donald Trump repeated his support on Friday for National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett as a possible pick to succeed Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve when Powell’s term ends in May of 2026.】

item.title: 民主党总检察长告诉法庭应调查 HPE 交易
item.description: 科罗拉多州和其他 19 个州的总检察长周五呼吁法院考虑否决美国司法部允许惠普公司以 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络的和解协议。【原文：Attorneys general from Colorado and 19 other states on Friday called for a court to consider rejecting a U.S. Department of Justice's settlement allowing Hewlett-Packard Enterprise to acquire Juniper Networks for $14 billion.】

item.title: Anthropic 告诉美国法官，它将支付 15 亿美元来解决作者集体诉讼案
item.description: Anthropic 公司周五向旧金山联邦法官表示，该公司已同意支付 15 亿美元，以解决一群作家提起的集体诉讼，这些作家指控这家人工智能公司未经许可使用他们的书籍来训练其人工智能聊天机器人 Claude。【原文：Anthropic told a San Francisco federal judge on Friday that it has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit from a group of authors who accused the artificial intelligence company of using their books to train its AI chatbot Claude without permission.】

item.title: Roblox 发布短视频应用，提高开发者收益
item.description: Roblox 在周五举行的开发者大会上宣布了一项新的短视频内容应用，并提高了创作者的收入。【原文：Roblox announced a new short-form video content application and an earnings increase for creators at its developers conference on Friday, looking to ride the wave of strong engagement and lure new users to the videogame platform.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比表示尚未决定是否在 9 月降息，并捍卫美联储的独立性
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五在数据显示就业市场进一步疲软后发表讲话称，他仍未决定9月是否是降息的合适时机，同时他还为美国央行不受短期政治压力影响的必要性进行了辩护。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee, speaking Friday after data showed further job-market weakening, said he is still undecided whether September is the right timing for an interest rate cut, while also defending the need to keep the U.S. central bank insulated from short-term political pressure.】

item.title: 公司利用美国债券市场融资近 700 亿美元，9 月伊始即热闹非凡
item.description: 本周迄今为止，投资级企业借款人在美国债务市场上的融资额接近 700 亿美元，超过了人们对劳动节缩短后的 9 月份第一周的预期，因为借贷成本仍接近历史最低水平。【原文：Investment-grade corporate borrowers tapped U.S. debt markets for nearly $70 billion so far this week, beating forecasts for the Labor Day-shortened first week of September as borrowing costs remain near record lows.】

item.title: 就业数据疲软，投资者期待美国更积极降息
item.description: 一份出人意料地疲软的美国就业报告凸显出经济正在放缓，投资者认为有必要加快货币宽松政策，包括本月大幅降息的可能性增加。【原文：After a surprisingly weak U.S. payrolls report that underscored that the economy is slowing, investors see the need for accelerated monetary easing, including an increased chance of a jumbo interest rate cut this month.】

item.title: 食品杂货商敦促谷物贸易商支持巴西的大豆暂停倡议
item.description: 包括乐购（Tesco）、塞恩斯伯里（Sainsbury's）和阿尔迪（Aldi）（ALDIEI.UL）在内的大型食品零售商已敦促全球谷物贸易商捍卫巴西的大豆暂停倡议，该倡议旨在保护巴西亚马逊地区免遭大豆导致的森林砍伐。【原文：Large food retailers, including Tesco , Sainsbury's and Aldi (ALDIEI.UL) have urged global grain traders to defend Brazil's soy moratorium initiative, a pact designed to protect the Brazilian Amazon from soy-driven deforestation.】

item.title: 美国债券市场可能对潜在的财政和通胀风险过于乐观
item.description: 一些投资者看到了美国债券市场的潜在裂痕，以及近期震荡走势的红色信号，认为市场低估了长期财政风险，以及白宫施压央行降息所带来的危险。【原文：Some investors see potential cracks in the U.S. bond market and red flags from recent whipsawing moves, saying the market is underpricing long-term fiscal risks and the danger posed by White House pressure on the central bank to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 康诺科公司首席执行官对面临大幅裁员的员工说："我责怪自己没有多加关注
item.description: 康菲石油公司首席执行官莱恩-兰斯（Ryan Lance）周四告诉员工，他不得不裁员多达 25% 的原因之一是，这家美国石油和天然气生产商由于专注于吞并规模较小的竞争对手，竞争力有所下降。【原文：ConocoPhillips CEO Ryan Lance told employees on Thursday that one of the reasons he had to cut up to 25% of the workforce was because the U.S. oil and gas producer had become less competitive as it focused on swallowing smaller rivals.】

item.title: 俄罗斯列出可在网络中断后继续使用的本地应用程序清单
item.description: 俄罗斯公布了一份本地开发的社交媒体、打车软件和其他应用程序的清单，称这些应用程序将在其移动互联网关闭期间继续运行。【原文：Russia published a list of locally developed social media, ride-hailing and other apps that it said would keep working during its mobile internet shutdowns - blackouts that have often been ordered to disrupt Ukrainian drone attacks.】

item.title: 美国计划制定针对进口中国无人机和重型汽车的规则
item.description: 特朗普政府计划以国家安全为由，继早些时候对汽车和卡车实施打压之后，再发布针对进口中国无人机和中型及重型车辆的规定。【原文：The Trump administration plans to issue rules targeting imports of Chinese drones and medium and heavy-duty vehicles after an earlier crackdown on cars and trucks, citing national security concerns.】

item.title: 财政部长贝森特呼吁对美联储进行 "全面 "审查
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周五呼吁重新审查美联储，包括其设定利率的权力，因为特朗普政府将继续努力对这家中央银行施加控制，而不受短期政治压力的影响被普遍认为是其有效性的关键。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Friday called for renewed scrutiny of the Federal Reserve, including its power to set interest rates, as the Trump administration continues its efforts to exert control over a central bank whose insulation from short-term political pressures is widely seen as key to its effectiveness.】

item.title: 消息人士称，哈里伯顿因石油业务下滑而裁员
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，美国油田服务提供商哈里伯顿公司最近几周一直在裁员，这是美国石油行业在面临成本上升、价格下跌和波动时期的最新一次裁员。【原文：U.S. oilfield services provider Halliburton has been cutting staff in recent weeks, according to two sources familiar with the matter, marking the latest workforce reduction in the U.S. oil industry as it faces rising costs and a period of lower prices and volatility.】

item.title: 巴西卢拉宣布为农民提供 22 亿美元债务减免方案
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦周五宣布了一项 120 亿雷亚尔（22.1 亿美元）的债务重新谈判方案，旨在支持多达 10 万名农业生产者，主要是受近期气候事件影响的中小型农户。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva announced on Friday a 12 billion reais ($2.21 billion) debt renegotiation package aimed at supporting up to 100,000 agricultural producers, primarily small and medium-sized farmers affected by recent climate events.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Thoma Bravo 将出售学校安全软件商 Raptor Technologies
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 Thoma Bravo 计划出售旗下的学校安全软件供应商 Raptor Technologies，该公司的估值可能超过 20 亿美元。【原文：Private equity firm Thoma Bravo plans to sell its school safety software provider Raptor Technologies, which could value the company at more than $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 白宫审查生物燃料豁免计划，农民与炼油商针锋相对
item.description: 白宫正在审查一项事关重大的规则，该规则可能会通过决定如何--甚至是否--重新分配最近根据《可再生燃料标准》豁免的大量生物燃料混合义务，重塑炼油商和农民之间的利益平衡。【原文：The White House is reviewing a high-stakes rule that could reshape the balance of interests between oil refiners and farmers by determining how - or even whether - to redistribute huge volumes of biofuel blending obligations that were recently exempted under the Renewable Fuel Standard.】

item.title: 谷歌因广告技术行为被欧盟处以 34.5 亿美元反垄断罚款
item.description: 周五，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌因其利润丰厚的广告技术业务中的反竞争行为被欧盟处以 29.5 亿欧元（约合 34.5 亿美元）的反垄断罚款，这是该公司与欧盟竞争监管机构长达十年之久的斗争中受到的第四次处罚。【原文：Alphabet's Google was hit with a 2.95-billion-euro ($3.45 billion) EU antitrust fine on Friday for anti-competitive practices in its lucrative adtech business, marking its fourth penalty in its decade long fight with EU competition regulators.】

item.title: 希腊与 OpenAI 达成协议，促进学校和小型企业的创新发展
item.description: 总部位于美国的人工智能公司OpenAI周五表示，希腊和OpenAI签署了一份谅解备忘录，以扩大中学教育中人工智能工具的使用范围，并促进小企业的创新。【原文：Greece and OpenAI signed a memorandum of understanding on Friday to broaden access to AI tools in secondary education and foster innovation among small businesses, the U.S.-based artificial intelligence company said.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Alphabet 旗下谷歌周五将因广告技术问题被欧盟处以反垄断罚款
item.description: 三位直接了解此事的消息人士称，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌将于周五晚些时候因其广告技术行为被欧盟处以反垄断罚款。【原文：Alphabet's Google is set to be hit with an EU antitrust fine over its adtech practices later on Friday, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美联储发布疲软就业报告后，博鳌亚洲论坛预计美联储今年将两次减息
item.description: 博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）周五预测，在一份疲软的就业报告公布后，美国联邦储备委员会将在 9 月和 12 月两次降息 25 个基点。【原文：BofA Global Research on Friday forecast the U.S. Federal Reserve to deliver two 25 basis point (bp) cuts, in September and December, after a soft jobs report.】

item.title: 巴西中央银行加强金融系统安全
item.description: 继最近金融机构遭受网络攻击之后，巴西央行周五宣布了其董事会批准的加强巴西金融系统安全的新措施。【原文：Brazil's central bank on Friday announced new measures approved by its board to strengthen the security of the country's financial system, following recent cyberattacks on financial institutions.】

item.title: 捷豹路虎努力克服严重的破坏性网络漏洞
item.description: 这家豪华汽车制造商周五表示，捷豹路虎正在 "全力以赴 "解决一起严重扰乱其零售和生产活动的网络事件，其工厂员工被告知留在家中直至下周初。【原文：Jaguar Land Rover is working "at pace" to resolve a cyber incident that has severely disrupted its retail and production activities, the luxury carmaker said on Friday, with its factory staff told to stay at home until early next week.】

item.title: 德国梅尔茨为用于研究的 Nvidia 超级计算机举行落成典礼
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）周五为一台由英伟达（Nvidia）芯片驱动的世界第四快超级计算机举行了落成典礼，并表示这有助于欧洲赶上人工智能领域的领先者美国和中国。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz inaugurated a supercomputer powered by Nvidia chips on Friday that is the world's fourth-fastest, saying it helps Europe catch up with the leaders in AI, the United States and China.】

item.title: 就业市场疲软，美联储本月重启降息计划
item.description: 周五的一份政府报告显示，上个月的就业增长几近停止，失业率也有所上升，在此之前，美联储政策制定者似乎将在本月启动一系列降息措施，以支撑日益脆弱的就业市场。【原文：Federal Reserve policymakers look set to kick off a series of interest-rate cuts this month to shore up an increasingly fragile job market, after a government report Friday showed job gains last month skidded to a near stop, and the unemployment rate rose.】

item.title: 白宫称美国 8 月份就业数据令人失望
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）说，周五的美国政府报告显示上个月就业增长疲软，这令人失望，但下个月数据修正后应该会有所改善，他特别提到了住房问题。【原文：Friday's U.S. government report showing weaker job growth last month was disappointing but should improve when the data is revised next month, White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said, citing housing in particular.】

item.title: 印度财政部长表示，尽管美国征收关税，印度仍将继续购买俄罗斯石油
item.description: 印度财政部长周五表示，尽管特朗普政府决定对印度商品征收高额进口关税，但印度将继续购买俄罗斯石油，因为事实证明这很经济。【原文：India will continue to buy Russian oil as it proves economical, its finance minister said on Friday, despite the Trump administration's decision to impose heavy import tariffs on Indian goods due, in part, to its energy purchases from Moscow.】

item.title: 即时观点：美国 8 月就业增长大幅放缓，失业率攀升
item.description: 8 月份美国就业增长速度的放缓幅度超过预期，失业率上升，表明劳动力市场状况出现放缓迹象，并增强了美联储需要更加积极地降息的预期。【原文：The pace of U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in August, and the unemployment rate increased, pointing to signs of slowing labor market conditions and boosting expectations the Federal Reserve will need to be more aggressive in cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 美国 8 月份就业增长大幅减弱；失业率升至 4.3
item.description: 8 月份，美国就业增长急剧减弱，失业率上升至 4.3%，证实劳动力市场状况正在走软，为美联储本月降息奠定了基础。【原文：U.S. job growth weakened sharply in August while the unemployment rate increased to 4.3%, confirming that labor market conditions were softening and sealing the case for an interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 受降息预期影响，全球股票基金流入量猛增
item.description: 截至9月3日，全球股票基金创下三周以来最大单周流入量，原因是市场对美联储本月降息的预期不断增强，以及Alphabet获得有利的反垄断裁决提振了市场情绪。【原文：Global equity funds drew their biggest weekly inflows in three weeks in the period to September 3, lifted by growing expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut this month and a favorable antitrust ruling for Alphabet that buoyed sentiment.】
